column3: Description
Failure to recognise hazard (knowledge-based and so on)
Decision making process (rule-based or old or invalid rule used and so on)
Slips and lapses (skill-based, involuntary automaticity and so on)
Communication (inaccuracy or omission of verbal, written and so on)
Violation (deliberate action, acting outside scope and so on)
No procedures or protocols (not in place or unavailable and so on)
Inadequate procedures or protocols
Adherence to procedures or protocols
Process design (impractical and inefficient processes and so on)
Equipment or IT network failure (including immobilisation and accessories)
Commissioning, calibration, maintenance (including immobilisation and accessories)
Device, Product design
Equipment supplier related (withdrawal of support, servicing, spare parts)
Patient physical or medical condition (inability to remain still and so on)
Communication with the patient (language issues, comprehension and so on)
Patient choice, compliance
Inadequate leadership (inadequate supervision, congruence or consistency and so on)
Unclear responsibilities and lines of accountability (across the radiotherapy pathway)
Inadequate capital resources (equipment in use no longer fit for purpose and so on)
Inadequate staffing (insufficient staffing levels or skill mix necessary to meet the demands of a service and so on)
Inadequate training (inadequate or lack of training and so on)
Inadequate risk assessment (poor change management and so on)
Physical (power cut, control area excessively noisy, distractions and so on)
Natural factors (fire, flood and so on)
Other
